message.content:
In LibreOffice Calc, you can use the `SUBSTITUTE` function to remove single quotes from the contents of another cell.

Assuming the cell containing the text is A1, you can use the following formula:

`=SUBSTITUTE(A1,"'","")`

This will replace all single quotes (`'`) with an empty string (`""`), effectively removing them from the original text.

If you want to copy the contents from another cell and apply this formula to it, you can use the `INDIRECT` function to reference the cell:

`=SUBSTITUTE(INDIRECT("A1"),"'","")`

Where "A1" is the cell containing the text you want to modify. The `INDIRECT` function allows you to dynamically reference a cell by its name, rather than hardcoding it in the formula.

Note: Make sure to adjust the cell reference ("A1" in this example) to match the actual location of the cell containing the text you want to modify.
